body.p: To the Excelence of the govenor your Petitioner Elias Bryant wold Respectively Represent to your Excelence that at the August terme of the Whitley Circuit Court at 1863 that the Grand Jury of Whitley county found an enditement against your petitioner for selling liquor by the Quarte that he as a destiller had maid & manufactured that the Liquer was not sold or drunk on his pimesess that he sold the liquer beleaving that he had a Right to Sell and to let it be drink wheare Sold if not drunk on his primises he say at the present March terme he come in to court and plea gilty and submited the law and acts to the court and the court Rendered Judgement against him for the amount of twenty dollars he states that he acted in good faith and did not do anything but what he beleaved at the time he had a Right to do he states that he quite selling as soon as he found he was violating the law and that he had no intention of violating the law he thare for pays your Excelence to Remit the fine and to interpose and set the judgement asid and to Pardon your petitioner as he had no interest of any ofence and to pardon him for this offence and for all Proper Releaf
Sworn to before me by Elias Bryant this 18th day of April 1864

The undersigned say that thay beleave that the foregoing petition contains the truth and that Elisas Bryant is a good citizen and had no intent of volating the law and thinks it wal be an act of charity to Remit said fine

James Criscillio
Jerymiah Meadows
A. Q. Curd
T. J. Meadors
Wm Hunicut
M. E. White
C. S. Crockman
J. L. McCurty S. W. C.
J C Watkins clk
